snippet: Sierra Leone’s government said it would deploy a battalion to ensure patients and citizens who may be infected remain isolated.
abstract: Sierra Leone deploys hundreds of troops and police officers in effort to ensure that Ebola patients and family members who may be infected remain isolated; reports are surfacing that family members are entering clinics to take away relatives with the disease, not abiding by new rules of quarantining households; Sierra Leone has recorded the highest number of cases, 646, and second-highest deaths, 273.
lead_paragraph: Sierra Leone’s government said it would deploy a battalion to ensure patients and citizens who may be infected remain isolated.

headline.main: Sierra Leone Deploys Troops in Ebola Crisis
headline.print_headline: Sierra Leone Deploys Troops in Ebola Crisis

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
